text:

author: TwoCents
text:
En français, pour faire court : évitez, évitez, évitez. Sauvez votre peau. Service clientèle très évasif. Zéro soin pour vos articles coûteux dans l'expédition. Et s'il vous plaît, ignorez les réponses de VC dans Trust Pilot. Si seulement ils faisaient autant d'efforts dans leurs réponses privées avec les clients ! Mdr.

Oh my goodness where to even start with how bad this site is. I feel a sense of relief to see it's rated so poorly on this site - I know it's not just me. Sorry for the rant but...

I ordered an item in OCTOBER 2021. I finally got it in April 2022. Seller sent it on time, no problem. It went to Vestiaire... that's where it all went downhill. They sent it out to my address.... without my address line. Like, literally my Apartment number, Post code, and City. No street name, nothing. Sent back to the Vestiaire warehouse obviously because it couldn't be delivered without a street name (not that anyone from Vestiaire told me or emailed me that it came back, I had to find out myself later by asking). I message Customer Services - they're like, "Oh yeah, it's here! :-) :-P" Ok cool thanks for telling me. Ask for it to be sent out again. I tell them: for the love of god, use my correct address it's very IMPORTANT. (Please note my address is correct ON THE VESTIAIRE WEBSITE so it's not on me that they keep sending it incorrectly. I wrote it out again for them in the service chat). They say of course... long story short they re-attempt delivery with the same wrong address... wait for it... three more times. I mean, it's almost laughable. So - whatever - all trust in this site gone, can I at least have my delivery charge refunded? No response EVER. I have now asked maybe 7 times? Their response is always "Sorry this delay has happened, I'm here to help!" and I have to keep replying "Please refund me". They're not even saying no they just don't answer to that. It's like in their customer service guide it says "Just don't engage until the customer loses their mind and gives up out of sheer insanity and exhaustion".

Considering the price you're paying on this "luxury retailer site"... I say run. Ebay, Vinted, ANYTHING ELSE. This is bad bad bad. Don't even get me started on how the products they have on there are 50% good sellers, selling their ware, but then 50% just people buying new designer and jacking up the price... even though you can just buy it literally yourself straight from the designer's site. Vestiaire does nothing about it. Expert vintage sellers I follow have also posted about clear fakes being posted on Vestiaire. Whole site is just bad news.
title: Oh my goodness where to even start...

text: I have come to understand the agents have the power cancel a sale if they want the item or if they want to give it to an expert seller or collector. This can only have been an ‘internal’ sale as I checked the listing within 1 minute of the item being available online. Really disappointing like their customer service where you have to wait days for a response and also the response is usually not at all to do with the question asked in the first place. I think the reviews on here paint a pretty accurate picture of what happens when there is a problem - there is no sort of customer support. I think in general the customer support has gone down incredibly in the space of 2 years.
